IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO CONNECT PEOPLE WITH NATURE THROUGH LAND CONSERVATION, EDUCATION, ECOLOGICAL RESEARCH AND SUSTAINABLE LANDSCAPES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: BY CONNECTING PEOPLE WITH NATURE, BERNHEIM IMPROVES QUALITY OF LIFE, THE UNDERSTANDING OF ECOLOGICAL ISSUES AND THE ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL VALUES OF NATURE.
IRS990.Desc: BERNHEIM ENCOMPASSES 16,143 ACRES AND IS THE LARGEST PRIVATELY HELD FOREST IN THE EASTERN UNITED STATES DEDICATED TO NATURE-BASED EDUCATION AND CONSERVATION. ANNUALLY, BERNHEIM WELCOMES 350,000 VISITORS AND PROVIDED NATURE-BASED EDUCATION TO OVER 10,000 STUDENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES. BERNHEIM'S MISSION, CONNECTING PEOPLE WITH NATURE IS REALIZED WHEN A VISITOR EXPLORES OUR SCENIC WOODLANDS CROSSED BY OVER 40 MILES OF HIKING TRAILS; ATTENDS AN AWARD-WINNING NATURE-BASED EDUCATION PROGRAM; VOLUNTEERS WITH HORTICULTURE IN BERNHEIM'S 600-ACRE ARBORETUM; MEETS AN ARTIST CREATING "ART IN NATURE" AS PART OF BERNHEIM'S FORTY + YEARS ARTIST IN RESIDENCY PROGRAM; PARTICIPATES IN A "FREE PLAY DAY" HOSTED BY BERNHEIM'S CHILDREN AT PLAY NETWORK; ENJOYS A MEAL HARVESTED FROM BERNHEIM'S EDIBLE GARDEN AND PREPARED AT ISAAC'S CAF; AND THROUGH BERNHEIM'S ECOLOGICAL STEWARDSHIP, SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH, AND CONSERVATION EFFORTS. BERNHEIM'S VISION IS TO BECOME "A NATIONALLY TREASURED LEADER IN ECOLOGICAL STEWARDSHIP THAT INSPIRES THE EXPLORATION OF OUR DEEP CONNECTIONS WITH NATURE." FRAMED BY THIS VISION, BERNHEIM FOREST INITIATIVES STRATEGICALLY ADDRESS HOW WE APPROACH OUR WORK, THROUGH FOUR BIG IDEAS THOUGHT LEADERSHIP, ACTIONS BEYOND OUR BORDERS, LEADERSHIP IN ECOLOGICAL STEWARDSHIP, AND EXPLORING DEEP CONNECTIONS WITH NATURE. BERNHEIM WORKS AT THE REGIONAL LEVEL, FOCUSING ON BUILDING UNIQUE PARTNERSHIPS AND LEVERAGING COLLECTIVE IMPACT, HELPING US ACHIEVE OUR MISSION AND VISION.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: MISCELLANEOUS REVENUE - 2018 AMOUNT: $ 122,619. 2019 AMOUNT: $ 7,051. 2020 AMOUNT: $ 17,061. 2021 AMOUNT: $ 10,022. 2022 AMOUNT: $ 30,025.

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: FUNDS HELD IN TRUST BY OTHERS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE INTENDED USE OF THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE TO SUPPORT THE OPERATIONS AND PROGRAMS OF THE ORGANIZATION.

THE FOUNDATION QUALIFIES AS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND IS CLASSIFIED AS OTHER THAN A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. ACCORDINGLY, NO INCOME TAXES HAVE BEEN PROVIDED IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE FOUNDATION RECOGNIZES UNCERTAIN INCOME TAX POSITIONS USING THE "MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT" APPROACH AS DEFINED IN THE ASC. NO LIABILITY FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS HAS BEEN RECORDED IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
CHANGE IN BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN FUNDS HELD BY OTHERS 7,749,558.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: JON BURNHAM, KIMBERLY B. SCHNEIDER, AND DEBRA BURNHAM HYMAN ALL HAVE FAMILY RELATIONSHIPS. TOM BLOCK IS A DIRECT DESCENDANT (GREAT GRANDSON).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF THE DRAFT FORM 990 WAS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR FOR THEIR REVIEW PRIOR TO BEING FINALIZED AND FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH COVERED PERSON SHALL ANNUALLY SIGN A STATEMENT AFFIRMING THAT SUCH COVERED PERSON: HAS RECEIVED A COPY OF THE POLICY, HAS READ AND UNDERSTANDS THE POLICY, HAS AGREED TO COMPLY WITH THE POLICY, AND UNDERSTANDS THAT THE CORPORATION IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE CODE, AND IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN ITS FEDERAL TAX EXEMPTION, THE CORPORATION MUST ENGAGE PRIMARILY IN ACTIVITIES WHICH ACCOMPLISH ONE OR MORE OF ITS EXEMPT PURPOSES. IN CONNECTION WITH ANY ACTUAL OR POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST, AN INTERESTED PERSON SHALL DISCLOSE THE EXISTENCE OF THE FINANCIAL INTEREST AND BE GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO DISCLOSE ALL MATERIAL FACTS REGARDING THE FINANCIAL INTEREST TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE BOARD SHALL DETERMINE IF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS. IF A CONFLICT EXISTS, AN INTERESTED PERSON MAY MAKE A PRESENTATION TO THE BOARD, BUT AN INTERESTED PERSON SHALL NOT BE PRESENT DURING THE BOARD DISCUSSION OF THE TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT INVOLVING THE POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST AND SHALL ABSTAIN FROM VOTING ON THE EXISTENCE OF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST. THE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD SHALL, IF APPROPRIATE, APPOINT A DISINTERESTED PERSON OR COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE ALTERNATIVES TO THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT. IF A MORE ADVANTAGEOUS TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT IS NOT REASONABLY POSSIBLE UNDER CIRCUMSTANCES NOT PRODUCING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST, THE BOARD SHALL DETERMINE BY A MAJORITY VOTE OF THE DISINTERESTED TRUSTEES WHETHER THE TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT IS IN THE CORPORATION'S BEST INTEREST, FOR ITS OWN BENEFIT, AND WHETHER IT IS FAIR AND REASONABLE. IN CONFORMITY WITH THE ABOVE DETERMINATION, THE BOARD SHALL MAKE ITS DECISION AS TO WHETHER TO ENTER INTO THE TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED AND ADJUSTED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BASED ON COMPARABLE SALARIES AT LIKE ORGANIZATIONS WHICH IS DOCUMENTED IN THE BOARD MINUTES. A COMPARABILITY STUDY WAS DONE IN 2017 USING THE NATIONAL AND REGIONAL GUIDESTAR PUBLISHED SURVEYS. ALL OTHER SALARIES ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND DOCUMENTED IN THE EMPLOYEE PERSONNEL FILES. COMPARISON TO OTHER LIKE ORGANIZATIONS AND LOCAL WAGES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COPIES OF THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE KEPT IN THE ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICES AT BERNHEIM FOREST AND ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
CHANGE IN BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN FUNDS HELD BY OTHERS -7,749,558.
